REF AD2.22.5.1.3 COORDINATION WITH NETWORK : READ : 'CDG AIRPORT PDS IS DIRECTLY CONNECTED WITH THE NETWORK MANAGER OPERATION CENTER (NMOC) FOR DATA EXCHANGE (COLLABORATIVE MANAGEMENT OF FLIGHT UPDATES). DATA ARE AUTOMATICALLY EXCHANGED THROUGH DPI AND API MESSAGES, WHICH INCLUDE TARGET TAKE-OFF TIMES, TAKEN INTO ACCOUNT BY NETWORK MANAGER OPERATION CENTER FOR EN ROUTE TRAFFIC PREDICTION AND FOR SLOT ALLOCATION. DPI AND API ARE OF DIFFERENT TYPES : GENERAL ARRIVAL PLANNING INFORMATION (G-API) PREDICTED DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION EARLY DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (E-DPI) TARGET DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (T-DPI) ATC DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (A-DPI) CANCEL DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (C-DPI) THE REA MESSAGE IS NO LONGER USED AND REPLACED BY DPI MESSAGES SYSTEMATICALLY AND AUTOMATICALLY SENT. INSTEAD OF : 'CDG AIRPORT PDS IS DIRECTLY CONNECTED WITH THE NETWORK MANAGER OPERATION CENTER FOR DATA EXCHANGE (COLLABORATIVE MANAGEMENT OF FLIGHT UPDATES). DATA ARE AUTOMATICALLY EXCHANGED THROUGH DPI MESSAGES, WHICH INCLUDE TARGET TAKE-OFF TIMES, TAKEN INTO ACCOUNT BY NETWORK MANAGER OPERATION CENTER FOR EN ROUTE TRAFFIC PREDICTION AND FOR SLOT ALLOCATION. DATA ARE AUTOMATICALLY EXCHANGED THROUGH DPI AND API MESSAGES WHICH INCLUDE TARGET TAKE-OFF TIME AND ESTIMED LANDING TIME, TAKEN INTO ACCOUNT BY THE NETWORK MANAGER OPERATION CENTER FOR EN-ROUTE TRAFFIC PREDICTION AND FOR SLOT ALLOCATION. DIFFERENT TYPES OF DPI AND API ARE: -GENERAL ARRIVAL PLANNING INFORMATION (G-API) -PREDICTED DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (P-DPI) -EARLY DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (E-DPI) -TARGET DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (T-DPI) -ATC DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (A-DPI) -CANCEL DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (C-DPI) THE REA MESSAGE IS NO LONGER TO BE USED REA AS IT IS REPLACED BY DPI MESSSAGES SYSTEMATICALLY AND AUTOMATICALLY SENT. SX0031/24 AIP SUPPLEMENT LFMN/NICE/COTE EXPERIMENTATION OF 4 INITIAL APPROACH PROCEDURES TO FACILITATE OPTIMIZED DESCENTS. VALIDITY: 18APR24 - 25DEC24 THIS AIP SUP CONCERNS THE OPERATIONAL ASSESSMENT OF OPTIMIZED DESCENT PROFILES ON THE INITIAL APPROACHES (INA = INITIAL APPROACH PROCEDURE) OF FLIGHTS INBOUND FOR NICE COTE D AZUR (LFMN). AN OPTIMIZED DESCENT MEANS A DESCENT WITH REDUCED FUEL CONSUMPTION AND NOISE POLLUTION (TO DESCEND CONTINUOUSLY, TO THE GREATEST POSSIBLE EXTENT, BY EMPLOYING MINIMUM ENGINE THRUST, IDEALLY IN A LOW DRAG CONFIGURATION, PRIOR TO THE FINAL APPROACH POINT). THROUGHOUT THE VALIDITY PERIOD OF THIS AIP SUP, AND WHEN CONDITIONS ALLOW (TRAFFIC, WEATHER, ETC.), THE CONTROLLER USES THE PROCEDURES PUBLISHED IN ORDER TO LIMIT RADAR VECTORING. THE CREWS, WITH THE INFORMATION OF THE DISTANCE REMAINING TO THE RUNWAY MUST PERFORM OPTIMIZED DESCENTS AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE THE OPERATIONAL ASSESSMENT WILL TAKE PLACE AT ANY TIME (DAY OR NIGHT), DURING LIGHT TRAFFIC SITUATION, ONCE THE AIRCRAFT HAS BEEN TRANSFERRED TO NICE APP. IF THE TRAFFIC SITUATION DOES NOT ALLOW THE USE OF THE TRAJECTORIES,THE PILOT SHOULD EXPECT RADAR VECTORING TOWARDS THE INITIAL FIX OF THE PROCEDURE IN USE. RNAV(GNSS) PROCEDURES: RWY04R RAPOT1M/1N RWY04L LEMPU1M/1N RWY04L/R BISBO1M/1N RWY22L/R SOTOX1M/1N

DEPARTURE PLANNING INFORMATION (DPI) MSG PROVIDED TO NETWORK MANAGER OPERATIONS CENTER (NMOC). 1.1. ADS-B DATA REQUIRED 1.1.1. FOR ADS-B DATA USED BY THE AD OPERATOR AND EUROCONTROL, PILOTS OF AIRCRAFT EQUIPPED WITH MODE S AND ADS-B FUNCTIONALITY MUST, WHEN OPERATING ON THE GROUND: A) SELECT AUTOMATIC MODE AND THE ASSIGNED MODE A, OR B) IF AUTOMATIC MODE IS NOT AVAILABLE, SELECT ON AND THE ASSIGNED MODE A - FROM THE REQUEST OF PUSH-BACK. - AFTER LANDING, UNTIL THE AIRCRAFT HAS STOPPED ON HIS STAND. - WHEN THE AIRCRAFT IS FULLY PARKED, THE PILOT SHALL SELECT STBY. 1.1.2. WHEN THE AIRCRAFT IS CAPABLE OF COMMUNICATING ITS IDENTIFICATION (I.E. THE CALLSIGN USED IN FLIGHT), THIS MUST BE ENTERED (VIA THE FMS OR TRANSPONDER CONTROL PANEL) AT THE TIME OF THE PUSH-BACK REQUEST. 1.1.3. THE CREW MUST USE THE FORMAT DEFINED BY ICAO TO ENTER THE AIRCRAFT IDENTIFICATION. 1.1.4. IN ORDER NOT TO COMPROMISE THE PERFORMANCE OF SYSTEMS BASED ON SSR FREQUENCIES (INCLUDING AIRBORNE TCAS AND SSR RADARS), TCAS SHOULD NOT BE SELECTED BEFORE RECEIVING CLEARANCE TO LINE UP, AND SHOULD BE DESELECTED AFTER VACATING THE RUNWAY.

SX0019/24 AIP SUPPLEMENT LFSB/BASLE/MULHOUSE VALIDITY: 03APR24 0300 - 15JUN24 0300 UTC -DESCRIPTION : THIS AIP SUP DESCRIBES THE PROGRESS OF WORK TO REPAIR PART OF TAXIWAY BRAVO, BETWEEN TAXIWAYS ECHO AND FOX. THE OPERATIONS WILL TAKE PLACE IN ONE WORK PHASE, ACTIVATED BY NOTAM. -GENERAL DISPOSITIONS : WORK CARRIED OUT AT NIGHT AND/OR DURING THE DAY. -AWO : FLIGHT PROCEDURES IN BAD WEATHER CONDITIONS (LVP) WILL NOT BE AFFECTED, BUT GROUND TAXIING WILL BE ADAPTED (STOP BARS OUT OF SERVICE). ACFT TAXIING WILL BE PARTIALLY REROUTED VIA TAXIWAY ALPHA AND THE MAIN RWY, DEPENDING ON THEIR WINGSPAN. ALL ARRIVING ACFT WILL BE PLACED BY A MARSHALL (FOLLOW-ME). - RESTRICTIONS / REGULATIONS : TRAFFIC REGULATIONS MEASURES WILL BE SET UP AND WAITING TIMES ARE TO BE EXPECTED ON ARRIVAL AND ON DEPARTURE. A35K, A388, CSM AND A346 ACFT WILL NOT BE ACCEPTED ON THE PLATFORM DURING THE CONSTRUCTION PERIOD (DUE TO GROUND TRAFFIC RESTRICTIONS). EXCEPT FOR MOVEMENTS ON THE MAIN RWY, FOUR-ENGINED ACFT WILL HAVE TO TAXI ON THE PLATFORM WITH THE OUTER ENGINES SHUT DOWN. SECONDARY RWY 07/25 WILL BE CLOSED WHEN QFU 33 IS IN USE. THE NORTH APRON WILL BE RESERVED FOR ACFT WITH WINGSPANS 44 M. CREWS OF ACFT WITH WINGSPANS 44 M MUST TAXI WITH CARE ON TAXIWAYS FOX AND GOLF AND MUST USE THE OVERSTEERING TECHNIQUE. CREWS OF ACFT WITH WINGSPANS BETWEEN 24 M AND 36 M MUST TAXI WITH CARE ON TAXIWAYS M1 AND M2 AND MUST USE THE OVERSTEERING TECHNIQUE. TAXIWAY ECHO WILL BE RESERVED FOR ACFT WITH WINGSPANS 36 M. TAXIWAY BRAVO BETWEEN 1 AND ECHO WILL BE RESERVED FOR ACFT WITH WINGSPANS 36 M. THE WORKSITE WILL BE SET UP DURING THE NIGHT BETWEEN APRIL 2 AND APRIL 3 2024.

SX0060/22 AIP SUPPLEMENT EBBU/FIR - RESTRICTIONS RELATED TO THE RUSSIAN INVASION OF UKRAINE - 08SEP22-UFN 1 AVOIDANCE OF OPERATIONS IN THE CRISIS AREA BELGIAN AIR OPERATORS AND OWNERS OF AIRCRAFT REGISTERED IN BELGIUM SHALL NOT ENTER UKBU, UKLV, UKBV, UKDV, UKFV, UKOV, URRV. FLIGHT OPERATIONS SHALL ALSO BE AVOIDED WITHIN THE BUFFER ZONE EXTENDING OUT TO 200 NM ALONG THE UKRAINE/RUSSIA BORDER. OPERATIONS WITHIN LUUU SHALL ONLY BE UNDERTAKEN IN COMPLIANCE WITH THE APPLICABLE AERONAUTICAL PUBLICATIONS ISSUED BY THE REPUBLIC OF MOLDOVA. ADDITIONAL RISK ASSESSMENT AND FLIGHT PLANNING DECISIONS SHALL BE TAKEN BEFORE OPERATING UUWV. 2 RESTRICTIONS FOR RUSSIAN OPERATORS LL RUSSIAN REGISTERED AIRCRAFT AND AIRCRAFT OWNED, CHARTERED OR OPERATED, OR OTHERWISE CONTROLLED BY NATURAL OR LEGAL PERSONS FROM THE RUSSIAN FEDERATION OR BY OPERATORS HOLDING AN AIR OPERATOR CERTIFICATE (AOC) ISSUED BY THE RUSSIAN FEDERATION AUTHORITIES ARE PROHIBITED TO ENTER, EXIT OR OVERFLY BELGIAN AND LUXEMBOURGISH AIRSPACE, EXCEPT FOR HUMANITARIAN, SAR AND LEASED AIRCRAFT ONE-WAY RETURN FLIGHTS WITH THE PERMISSION OF THE APPROPRIATE BELGIAN OR LUXEMBOURGISH AUTHORITIES AND IN CASE OF EMERGENCY LANDING OR EMERGENCY OVERFLIGHT.
